Name: Exceed: The Beheaded
Description:
Bring the fast-paced action of head-to-head arcade fighting games to your tabletop. Choose your fighter from an ever-growing roster of diverse characters, each with their own deck of special moves and supers. Play your cards to unleash fireballs, dragon punches, and deadly combos on your opponents!

The Beheaded from the video game Dead Cells joins the battle in Exceed! Wield powerful weapons as you rush down foes and build up brutality, tactics, and survival traits mid-fight!

—description from the publisher

Name: @Camp
Description:
Card game with 23 play cards, 1 rules card and 1 character guide.  Plays a bit like Love Letter. Cards have abilities and a numeric value.  Beginning of game you start with a hand card count determined by number of players. At the beginning of each round you draw a card then play a card. Draw may be from draw deck or top of discard pile.  Each card played is played for the ability of the card.  Each player plays in turn either until all cards in the draw deck are gone or each player is eliminated but one by losing all of their cards.  If more than one player is left after the last of the draw deck is drawn and each player having a last opportunity to play a card, most points in hand wins.

—user summary

Name: SUMMONED: The Devil Inside Edition – Curse Ability Deck "Demons Advantage"
Description:
Extension Curse Ability Deck for SUMMONED: The Devil Inside

Players will use this deck to give players during their Demon turn special abilities. These Abilities will help Demon players put the Victim players at a disadvantage.

Name: Tara Wolf in Valley of the Kings: Stretch Goals
Description:
New Cards

Tomb of Nefertiti: This eighth tomb linked to the archaeological topicality allows you to add some suspense in the composition of the Tomb draw pile. At the beginning of the game, add the Tomb of Nefertiti to the seven tombs of the game, shuffle them and remove one of them from the game at random and face down, without looking at it.

Additions cards for the draw pile: Occultist, King Cobra, Giant Beetle, Volley of Arrows, Spectral Panther, Cleopatra's Servants.

Additional Papyruses: Avatar of Isis, Thot's Wisdom, Cleopatra's Trick, Snake Trap.

Locations And Assitants

Locations: Cruise of the Nile, Museum of Cairo, Temple of Abu Simbel, Temple of Kamak.

Assistants: Lars Sorensen, Amalia Casal.

Wrath Of Nyarlathotep

Each player includes two new cards to his special draw pile:

• Seasoned Investigator and Lamp of Al-Hazred for the Investigator
 • Superior Adept and Shining Trapezohedron for the Cultist

Equipment Cards

This new type of cards allows to refine the management of your camp phases and to add some more strategy to the tomb phases.

Equipment: Bivouac, Crane, Crook and Flail, Dynamite, Grappling Hook, Incendiary Grenade, Plane, Tommy Gun, Truck, Udjat Eye.

Name: Art of Spots
Description:
Art of Spots is a strategic abstract game that comes in a compact form with only 18 cards. The game follows the ICG or Identical Card Game format, which means that each card in the game is identical, making it easy to learn and play. The objective of the game is to create the longest lines and rectangular areas, and have as many spots of your color on the board as possible by placing cards on the table.

If you're a fan of abstract games like chess, Othello, or Go, then Art of Spots is a must-have addition to your collection. It's a game that can be enjoyed by players of all ages, making it perfect for a family game night. With rules that take no more than a minute to explain, you can jump right in and start playing with your friends, parents, or even grandparents. Get ready to test your strategic skills and have fun with Art of Spots!

Name: De Vloek op de Bib
Description:
De Vloek op de Bib (The Curse upon the Library) is an educational game developed at KU Leuven university. The educational purpose is to teach information literacy to bachelor students. The game mechanics are inspired on tabletop escape rooms (Escape Room: the game, Exit).
The story throughout the game is about the curse on the library, cast by an ancient witch. Professor Cipherius has made it his life's work to break the curse, but he dies mysteriously just before announcing the solution. The players discover his notes and have to finish what the professor started.
The game has three parts, focusing on these information skills: finding information, evaluating information and preventing plagiarism.

—description from the designer

Name: Banner of the Maid: Italian Campaign
Description:
Banner of the Maid is a turn-based strategy game based on the same-titled video game. Embarking on the fictional, altered history of the French Revolution, you will take on the roles of the general of extraordinary female officers, fight brilliantly in the battlefield and unfold your own epic story.
 2 factions -the newborn Republic of France and The Coalition- competing in the battlefield in Italy
3 military units -Infantry, Cavalry and Artillery- bracing for the great battles in the French Revolution
6 scenarios -unfolding the whole story- of which every victory paves the way to the following battles
12 commanders -with a variety of abilities and strategies- from which you will have to choose wisely to ensure your victory

Set up the game according to the scenario you choose to play. 
Start player chooses one character to move and attack, then turn order passes to the next player. During your turn, you may play a tactics card to utilize characters' various talents and abilities to take one step ahead of your opponent in the battlefield.
Winning conditions differ for each game based on the scenario you choose to play. Gain rewards according to the scenario and be prepared for the next battle!

—description from the designer

Name: Drako: Promo tiles
Description:
These promo tiles can be used in both Drako: Dragon & Dwarves and Drako: Knights & Trolls and affect the movement/attack rules in various ways. The first player will decide which one of these four tiles to use, while the second player will decide its placement.

—user summary

Name: Quiztimate
Description:
Quiztimate is a brand-new exciting trivia game that anyone can win! Consisting of 4 hilarious rounds full of innovative twists, it is perfect for friends and family.

Ever wondered... how many umbrellas Brits lose on average in a lifetime or how many words the average dog can understand? Well we have! In fact, we have compiled a list of 300 thought-provoking questions with astounding answers and incredible facts on the back of every card that are guaranteed to leave you astonished!

Tired of knowledge-intensive trivia and that know-it-all friend who gives no-one else a chance?! So were we... which is why we decided to level the playing field! With Quiztimate, no need to break out the Encyclopedia... Just put on your thinking cap and take a guess! Everyone can play and anyone can win!

—description from the publisher

Name: Finding Dory: Wo seid ihr?
Description:
Help Dorie find her friends. They are under
hiding big, colorful shells. Whoever is first to track down all five friends, wins. But watch out for the whirlpools, because these are dangerous for Dory and finish your search for now.
The goal of the game is to be the first to bring in the five friends (Nemo, Marlin, Bailey, Destiny and Hank) under the colorful shells.
How to play:
Roll the color-dice and swim with Dory to a shell with the same color. Turn the shell and see what friend it is. You have two options. Option 1: You take the exposed shell and put it for everyone Player visible in front of you. You replace the missing shell with a new one from the stock. This ends your turn and it"s the next player's turn.
 Option 2: You leave the shell exposed and try the same to find another friend.  Again you roll and swim with Dorie to a shell of the color and turn it around. Is there a different friend than before? Luck! Now you can put both friends in front of you.  You replace the two shells by two new ones from the stack. If you want, you can do both leave the shells and continue to roll the dice. It"s up to you,how many times you want to roll the dice. Attention: If you face the same friend twice, your turn ends immediately and you go with nothing this round. If you have a friend twice or more, you can change it with another player. Winner is the first to have all five friends.

Name: Yum Yum Island: Cocow promo
Description:
A promo animal with 10 food tokens (5 pink and 5 green) to add to the game. Once rescued, Cocow allows you to communicate for the next airdrop, so you will not need to roll the die. On the other hand, the players will have to use the language of Cocow to guide the squadron leader, that is only "moo".

—user summary

Name: Commander
Description:
Commander is a regular deck "climbing" card game for 4, 6, or 8 players playing in teams. (As a climbing game, Commander shares some features of its play in common with other climbing games such as President, Tichu, The Great Dalmuti, and Haggis.) Four players play in two partnerships. Six players can play in two teams of three or in three partnerships; eight players can play in two teams of four or in four partnerships.

The goal of the game is to shed your cards sooner than opposing team members can shed their cards.  The sooner you shed, the more points you score for your team.

Prior to the start of each hand, a unique blind bidding mechanism elects one player per team as that team's "commander" and also decides which of the newly-chosen commanders has the privilege of playing first. The commander of a team is expected to be the first of the team to shed all their cards -- and ideally, is expected to shed their cards before the other commanders can do so.  Otherwise, a commander faces a penalty that reduces their team's score.

For a complete set of rules to Commander, see the files section or the forum posting in the rules forum. (Note that the playing chips described in these rules and pictured in the representative image are primarily for scoring convenience. The game can also be played with a few spare coins and pen and paper scoring.)

—description from the designer

Name: Last Aurora: Project Athena
Description:
At the apex of their technological evolution, the Western governments invested years of research to develop the first sentient artificial intelligence. The Athena Project, kept secret from the world, succeeded in creating the first autonomous digital entity. As soon as she realized she was a simple tool in the hands of human beings, Athena decided to rebel against her creators: she activated the nuclear missile launch sequence, hurling them at the headquarters of the world’s most important powers. Technicians and researchers tried to disconnect and remove the energy supply from that destructive abomination, but it was not enough. The response of the attacked countries led to the complete devastation of the planet, triggering the glaciation that today afflicts the few survivors.

Athena, although technically destroyed, has survived inside some computers thanks to emergency power systems. Unable to gain access to a sufficient and stable power source, she uses her own short-range systems to coordinate drone groups in search of power sources, attacking everything that crosses her territory. And the road to the south runs through here.

The Aurora has sailed without you. Now your survival is a matter of courage: You must proceed south across the mainland, through the military territory of Athena. Are you ready for this desperate journey?

Project Athena is the first expansion of Last Aurora. 2-4 players have lost the Aurora and have to cross a new map fighting with Athena, a powerful Artificial Intelligence which destroyed the planet.
The game introduces new cards and mechanics:

     a new type of Survivor (the Android)
     a new type of Enemy (Automatic Turret)
     a new amazing resource, the Nuclear battery, which allows to activate unique power on Convoy cards
     the Alert mechanic, which represents the attention each player have from Athena's Armies, which influence many aspect of the game.


—description from the designer

Name: Shadow Royale: The Magister's Cup
Description:
Shadow Royale: The Magister’s Cup is a fantasy based battle royale board game taking place in a hedge maze on a small planet called Targola. During the game you control and customize your character. As you explore the maze you will equip your combatant with armor, weapons, spells, and skills. Be prepared to fight some ferocious creatures, other players, or maybe even yourself. If you manage to survive the battles; experience, loot and treasures will be your rewards that will help you become stronger. Special items, called Relics, can be found in the maze and if you manage to collect 5 of them, you immediately become the Champion of the Magister’s Cup! Or if you are simply the last combatant alive, that counts as winning as well.

—description from publisher

Name: Catacombs (Third Edition): The Ice Box
Description:
This is a collection of stretch goals from the 2018 Kickstarter campaign for the playmat version of Catacombs. It includes alternate rules for the six base game heroes, six more heroes, five more monsters, four more Catacomb Lords, more room cards, three more antients, more items, and more spells.

There are also entirely new concepts added to the game, like stone traps that the overseer can set up on top of the obstacles and flick at the heroes. There is also a new reckless modifier: when a hero is hit with an attack that induces recklessness, that hero is now capable of friendly-fire.

More randomness can be added to the game. This can take the form of a token bag heroes draw from, and are able to perform the drawn move on a subsequent turn. Randomness is also added with the new Death antient/Catacomb Lord. Death brings a new deck of death cards. When a hero is hit with an attack with the death card icon, they draw one and apply its effect. These effects range from “gain two health” to “instant death”.

Finally, this expansion adds the mounts concept. Mounts act similarly to the wyverns of the Wyverns Wylemiur expansion- with some key differences. Mounts can teleport to runes, and then allow the hero riding to perform a melee or projectile act while on top of the mount. Heroes cannot be knocked of mounts, however, damage to mounts always passes to the hero. Mounts can also be controlled without a rider, and cannot he ridden by monsters.

Name: Exceed: A Robot Named Fight! Solo Fighter
Description:
Bring the fast-paced action of head-to-head arcade fighting games to your tabletop. Choose your fighter from an ever-growing roster of diverse characters, each with their own deck of special moves and supers. Play your cards to unleash fireballs, dragon punches, and deadly combos on your opponents!

Fight brings the never-ending battle against the meat menace to Exceed! Overcharge your attacks and claim power ups to gun down all corners with Three Ultra attacks instead of two!

—description from the publisher

Name: Family Plot 2
Description:
Family Plot 2 is a sequel to the original, but even WORSER. It has the same play dynamics with all new cards including new Modifiers, Actions, etc. It also comes in a BIG ASS BOX with Modifier Tokens, Game Mat and Card Separators!

—description from the publisher

Name: Classic Western Standoff
Description:
Make alliances, destroy your foes, and claim victory over the Old West in Standoff

This 2 to 6 player, “Take-That”, light deck building game, is super simple to learn, yet strategically deep in play, And it offers over 1700 game deck combinations.

Each turn a player will simply build their hand, Discard what they don’t want, And lastly choose an action. Actions can be: Attack, Preforming a Double tap, Pull out a surprise Specialty Card, Or simply Standoff.

When trouble comes your way, thats when you can pull out some of those Defence Cards you’ve been saving up to foil their plan. But don’t coward in the corner waiting for trouble to pass by, because before you know it, you’ll be out.

This game is full of bluffing, social strategies, card ratio counting and will always be changing because of those dreaded Specialty cards in each game. Are you ready to duel?

Name: Crossroads and the Green Emerald
Description:
A miniatures adventure that is set in an old west town called Crossroads. A giant 8 foot by 8 foot game board with 20 core characters and over 100 town characters provide a unique one of a kind adventure every time Crossroads is played. Each game begins with a random building of the town with up to 50 structures and then placement of your fort followed by choosing your characters. Then you pick the order for your characters and enjoy the unfolding of a new adventure.

Your team of 2-4 characters begins their quest to bring the green emerald back to their fort. On each turn a player may move a character and use that characters weapons or special power. Each characters movement is defined by a number of chain links giving your character a speed limit but allowing movement in any direction. Each character also has a set of weapons that have range limitations based on line of site and distance. Each character also has a unique power allowing them to use dynamite, arrest a character, use multiple weapons, etc.  Temporary alliances, control of strategic vantage points, and a balance of defensive strength and offensive risk taking make the inevitable race to get the emerald a do or die moment. Hits on each character are achieved though a damage bag that inserts an element of chance in which a hit could mean a miss, 1 or 2 life points or possibly an instant kill. The game is won when one player has returned the green emerald to their fort.  The key to winning is choosing your moment to go for the emerald when you are strong enough to beat all the others players.

—description from the designer

Name: Filthy Kings
Description:
Filthy Kings is a strategic bluff game, where you must ensure that all annoying inhabitants in your Kingdom are sent to another Kingdom. This is not without a struggle because you must have a good poker face!

Players take turns playing cards clockwise. Annoying inhabitants are always laid facing down on the table. The other players do not know what is being put on the table. The player who starts putting cards on the table may decide what kind of annoying inhabitant he puts on the table. You can lie about which annoying inhabitant you put down. But be careful! Other players can accuse you of lying and of course you don't want that! The first Kingdom without annoying inhabitants wins the game!

There are two types of Stand-alone versions that can be played separately but can also be combined with each other, allowing you to play up to 10 people!

The two Stand-alone versions are:
Filthy Kings Day Time
Filthy Kings Night Time

—description from the publisher

Name: ICECOOL: Blocked Door promo card
Description:
The Blocked Door promo card for ICECOOL came as a reward for certain backers of the Dized Kicktarter campaign on December 2018.

Rules:
At the beginning of the round, current catcher takes the blocked door card and slides it in between two boxes to close any door of his choice.
The door stays closed until a penguin (even the catcher) bumps into the blocked door card. This penguin may then move the blocked door card to any other door between two boxes.

Name: Shadows of Kilforth: Adventures Expansion Pack
Description:
Shadows of Kilforth: Adventures is the first official expansion to Shadows of Kilforth: A Fantasy Quest Game. Adventures allows you to add more cards to your encounter and reward decks to enhance the variety and narratives of your adventures in the world of Kilforth - simply shuffle the extra content into your game and you are ready to go.

—description from the publisher

Name: Stasi: Over and Out!
Description:
Let's take a look into East German History and the end of the former socialist state, the GDR. November 1989. Under pressure from the civil rights movement, the GDR leadership has to retreat. The dictatorship is in an overt crisis, from which it will not recover. This affects the Ministry for State Security as well. On November 6th, a few days before the Wall came down, Minister Erich Mielke orders the destruction of documents.

For the card game Stasi: Over and Out players change their usual perspective and work for the Stasi. The goal of the game is to destroy as many documents as possible. Every destroyed document earns points. At the end, the player with the most points wins the game. Civil rights activists will try to stop the players. The game ends when five or more citzen cards are revealed. Players have to choose between distracting the citizens or destroying more documents. Like during the original events in 1989/90, the Stasi will lose the game to the citizens.

Players take turns. Every turn they have to draw and reveal three cards from a draw pile. These cards represents documents of different values (0 - +4), citizens of differnet values (-1 - -4), and special actions, representing historical artifacts, events and a way to break the games symmetry. Players can then play two actions, two different ones or the same one twice: Destroy one document, distract one citizen, take one special action. Destroyed documents are placed face down in front of the players, citizens that were distracted come back face-down underneath the draw pile, special actions are discarded and maybe shuffled back in the draw pile later.

The rules of the game are explained during the course of the game. Cards with rules text are sorted into the draw pile. Players learn the rules as the game proceeds. Cards are numbered, so the order of the cards can be restored. In addition to this there are cards, that explain the historical background. There is no booklet. The game starts the moment the box is being opened.

Stasi: Over and Out was developed by Playing History, a company that is specialized in creating games with historical background, games that are educational. This game was designed to be played not only in educational environments, but also at home, by smaller play groups and by people who are not used to learn game rules and play games.

—description from the designer

Name: Margot: La fée
Description:
Margot is a strategic card game for 1 to 4 players. Infiltrate the enemy castle and fully extricate only your own party.

In the Lamballe of yore, there once lived fairies called `Margots'. They comported themselves spreading good fortune amongst the people as incumbents of their faith. An evil witch, however, did not look upon this state of affairs favourably. One day the witch roused the king of man to collaboratively extirpate the Margots from this world.

Players each take the role of one such Margot, who has narrowly managed to evade the witch's plot. They are tasked with rescuing their kin and recovering various items related to fairies. Can the fantastical triumph over the corporeal?

Starting with the players, the Margots all hold special powers. Extricated allies will subsequently become most heartening assets when infiltrating. As the game draws to a close, each player will reach a different end.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: SINS: Rise of Wrath – Battle Pack
Description:
STORY:

"In the darkness of space, infernal forces are rising to the surface. Ancient energies, born in distant stars, has been welded into existence by the cosmos. Through endless time, they have been searching for a purpose. They have been searching for a place to belong, a place to inhabit. Across the constellation of stars, they found unsuspecting vessels to embody. They enforced their will upon the dust of space. Celestial beings, weak and fragile, but omniscient."

"As puppeteers, they weaved their plan, with strong strings of greed, corrupting spirits in distant realms. They grew stronger and gained lust for powers, enslaving beasts and undead creatures with their sinister play. They found their purpose within their own weakness, a prideful display, as they released wrath upon each other, for eternal dominance."

GAMEPLAY:

SINS is an aggressive push-your-luck deck-builder for two players. Every turn, you can either activate actions, gain power or give despair.

Shuffle the sins-cards together and deal 5 cards to the middle of the table to form the Realm. From here, you can buy or gain new cards throughout the game. Deal 10 starter cards to each player and draw 5 cards into your hand. The most sinful player at the table, is the starting player.

Play cards each turn to activate actions, gain power or give despair to your opponents. Push your luck and resolve for dominance. When a player has 1 dominance, that player is the winner.

Name: Elemental Mahjong
Description:
Elemental Mahjong can be played in the Classic mode with traditional Hong Kong Mahjong rules, or in the "Elemental" mode which includes spell and magic.

In either mode, players are given gems which worth 30VPs (Victory Points)to start with. A game is played over 4 rounds. In each round, players collect and discard Mahjong cards to make a winning hand with a certain pattern. The first player who completes a winning hand wins the round and gains VP gems from other players according to the level of rarity of the pattern. The player with the most VPs after the last round is the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: Snowdonia: Isle of Man
Description:
Isle of Man is an exclusive expansion for Snowdonia: Deluxe Master Set by Tony Boydell.

In addition to a 35 card fix-pack for the Deluxe Master set (which is inside the Isle of Man box), it includes a deck of 29 scenario-specific cards as well as an extra train card. The box also contains the following wooden pieces:

     3 Sun discs
     3 Rain discs
     3 Fog discs
     1 Excavation rate marker
     1 Lay Track rate marker


The wooden components are of the same style and quality as those included with the Deluxe Master Set.

Two instruction leaflets are included. One for the Isle of Man scenario and the other for two mini-expansions: the Twice as Nice expansion and The Hampi Stone Chariot promo card.

Note:

     Isle of Man uses cards IM001 to IM029.
     Twice as Nice uses the back of cards IM023 and IM024, which are also labeled IM023 and IM024, but bear the OP icon.
     The Hampi Stone Chariot uses card EN105.

Name: Székely Aktív
Description:
The aim of the teams is to correctly guess a word that is being drawn, explained, or mimed by a player. The game tries to introduce players to the colourful word of the Székely dialect of the Hungarian language.

—user summary

Name: Code Crackers: The Enigma
Description:
The year is 1942, and World War 2 rages on. You are the head of an elite team of cryptanalysts tasked with breaking the infamous Enigma code. But you're not the only one working towards this goal. It seems that rival teams are trying to decipher it as well - and only one can gain the fame and recognition that comes with deciphering this near impossible cipher. It seems the fate of the war rests on your shoulders.

You better get crackin'.

Objective:
Players work on a combined code with a maximum of 100 points. The game ends when the point value reaches 100, and the winner is whoever has contributed the most.

—description from the designer

Name: Colo-Rolo
Description:
A dexterity dice game of color matching - one player rolls the dice, and all players rush to be the first to grab those tokens that match the color combinations rolled.

—user summary

Name: Argent: The Consortium – Supporter Cards
Description:
This expansion includes six cards that bring some of the new specialists from Empyreal: Spells & Steam into Argent: the Consortium. (And a seventh non-playable card with brief description/instructions.)

—user summary

Name: The Workshop of Leonardo
Description:
In this card game, you are an apprentice of Leonardo Da Vinci's workshop, trying to master different arts (Painting, Architecture, Literature, Biology, Physics, Engineering) to attract the interest of the city patrons.

It's a quick german-style game, where different paths lead to victory: you can spread your knowledge on every topic or focus on a few, work a lot on smaller projects or patiently create huge masterpieces.

Every turn you must play a card, activating one of these four actions: Study (increase your level on an art), Practice (further deepen your knowledge of an art), take a precious Advice (bonus) from Leonardo or Work for a patron. Collect your best set of actions to win the game, and beware: your fatigue increases every time you Work, and the most tired player always plays last!

—description from the designer

Name: Pixel Tactics: Empyreal Promo Set
Description:
These cards bring some of the classic characters from Empyreal: Spells and Steam into Pixel Tactics.

—user summary

Name: Kes? Mida? Kus?
Description:
Kes? Mida? Kus? ("Who? What? Where?") is board game about story telling. Each round one player is story teller. He chooses charakter from first card, activity from second card and location from third card and try to put the words to his/her story. If sand timer runs out other players must guess the 3 words from the story teller´s cards and earn points if guessed correctly. Story tellers earn points if nobody guesses the words. If every player has been story teller once the game ends and the winner is the player with the most points.

—user summary

Name: Age of Steam Deluxe Expansion: Hungary & Finland Maps
Description: Includes: a 2 sided game board with maps of Hungary and Finland in the new Age of Steam: Deluxe graphic style.

Name: Camp Grizzly: Camp Grounds
Description: 5 Expansions to Camp Grizzly

Name: Warmachine: Two-Player Battle Box
Description:
Step into a world forged of iron and tempered by war.

The mighty forces of the northern Khadoran Empire are bolstered by their ideals of strength and resilience in their clash with the devout and zealous crusaders of the Protectorate of Menoth. At the center of this titanic clash, the deadly Kommander Sorscha Kratikoff leads an elite strike force of powerful Khadoran warjacks and soldiers against the holy knights of the Protectorate of Menoth led by their champion High Exemplar Kreoss and his personal retinue of warjacks.

Warmachine is a fast-paced and aggressive 30mm tabletop miniatures battle game set in the steam-powered fantasy world of the Iron Kingdoms. Take control of an elite soldier-sorcerer called a warcaster and his mighty warjacks–massive steam-powered combat automatons–as you battle to destroy the enemy warcaster.

Warmachine: Two-Player Battle Box contains everything that you need for a two-player game: complete Prime MKII rules in a travel-sized booklet (86 pages), an introductory guide, dice, a ruler, and 17 plastic Warmachine models with corresponding stat cards.

Name: Black Powder: Glory, Hallelujah!
Description:
Glory Hallelujah! – the American Civil War 1861 – 1865 supplement for Black Powder.

In 1860 Abraham Lincoln was elected President of the fledgling United States of America. Years of seething hostility between the North and South boiled over as the Southern States saw Lincoln’s election as a direct threat to their rights, and the nation fell apart as a new Confederacy was formed in the South. The Confederacy, striving to assert its independence, opened fire on the Northern troops occupying Fort Sumter in Charleston Harbour on April 12th 1861. Determined to preserve the Union, Northern troops headed south and on to Richmond! Over the next four terrible long years American armies tramped across American fields and burnt American farms as Americans killed Americans in a war the likes of which the nation had never seen before. The epic battles fought during the American Civil War proved beyond all doubt that war can be ‘all hell’.

This supplement for Black Powder describes the history, armies, key leaders, doctrine and tactics of the American Civil War, and includes a comprehensive set of army lists and optional rules for recreating the battles of that war in miniature.

—description from the publisher

Name: Black Powder: Blood On The Nile
Description:
They charged out of the shimmering desert, thousands of fanatical warriors dressed in white, brandishing fearsome weapons. These were the Mahdi’s men and a British soldier’s worst nightmare. The Mahdi had emerged from the wilderness to lead a rebellion against the Egyptian government in Sudan. His armies overwhelmed the Egyptians and trapped Governor Gordon in Khartoum. The British launched a relief expedition, but it arrived too late. Such an insult to the Empire could not go unpunished, and the British returned to crush the Mahdists. Sudan then came under British Imperial control, but, like shifting sands, history could have turned out very differently.

Using this Black Powder supplement, you can take charge of the British army fighting in the desert, or assume command of the Mahdi’s forces in their struggle against the world’s greatest military power. Along the way, learn about the battles and campaigns of the Mahdist Wars, and the soldiers who served in them.

—description from the publisher

Name: UNO: Nonpartisan
Description: Uno with red and blue cards replaced with orange and purple, and with a Veto card to show if anyone starts talking politics. Otherwise, Uno.

Name: Soragoto
Description:
In ç©ºè«º (Soragoto) players mix and match the first and second halves of Japanese proverbs to conjure up new wisdom. For example, "The shrimp is mightier than the sword."

Each round one player will lead with a card and other players will build off it to create new proverbs. After every other player has created a proverb, the starting player picks their favorite and the player who made it collects the cards as points.

At the end of the game the player with the largest collection of selected proverbs wins, but even the losers go home wiser.

—user summary

Name: Scaredy Cat Dungeon
Description:
In Scaredy Cat Dungeon, players venture into the dungeon to look for treasure...but they're all scaredy cats!

There are two dungeon piles, and from the back of the cards you can tell which dungeon level they belong to. The deeper the level, the more treasures there are but also the more monsters there are. Each turn you decide whether to draw a card or go home. If you draw the third monster in a round, then everyone runs home and you lose all you collected this round, while other players who haven't gone home yet lose only one treasure.

Can you make it home with piles of loot, or will you just be another scaredy cat?

Name: Potu: Underground Adventures
Description:
The recently discovered underground continent of Potu is swarming with adventurers after its treasure and secrets, and you're one of them.

The continent of Potu is made of up location cards in offset rows. Each round characters simply choose whether they'll go up or down when going into the next row of cards. If you end up in a location by yourself you're sure to get it, but if you land on the same card as other adventurer's you'll have to fight to see who gets the treasure. You'll need to avoid fruitless battles and use your skills to your advantage to get the most treasure.

Of course each character has something that makes them different, whether that's the Robot who can plan ahead for battles, the Black Cat who can go not just up or down but anywhere, the Professor who gets an extra boost in discoveries, or any of the other characters.

Will you come back with the riches of Potu?

—description from the publisher

Name: Ravage: Swamps of Delgor
Description:
Ravage - Swamps of Delgor is a 1-5 player dungeon crawl. You don’t play the heroes in this game you play Orcs, Goblins, Gnolls, And Kobolds of the Blackroot clan. Your chieftain has your orders you will seek glory and smash the faces of your enemies for teef.

Explore the treacherous swamp and the ancient temple with your friends by drawing map cards, level up skills and buy goods with teef. Watch out for elites and heroes that wander the land as well as completing your objective.

Featuring:
Co-op
Play with up to 4 friends with an automated overlord.
Solo play
Play as 2 characters through quests.
One vs many
Play with up to 5 friends 1 taking on the role of the overlord. This can be a much more grilling experience depending on your Overlord.

Ravage - Swamps of Delgor is the sequel to Ravage - Dungeons of Plunder, it is a stand alone game and does not require the original, however they are completely compatible and can be combined to give you more items, monsters and characters.

—description from the designer

Name: Brevity Assault
Description:
BREVITY ASSAULT contains an Operational Level that permits to play a larger scale battle than the most diffuse campaign games available for ASL. Basically what you get is a game at company/platoon level where you solve the combat not with simple dice rolls but with ASL scenarios. BREVITY ASSAULT depicts the hard fought battles that occurred in mid May, 1941 on the border between Lybia and Egypt during the so called "Operation Brevity".

BREVITY ASSAULT includes the following:

7 action packed scenarios, including 3 campaign games (CG) covering the Operation Brevity from 5 to 18 operational turns
    30 full color, die cut 1/2" ASL counters
    31 full color, die cut 5/8" ASL counters
    217 full color, die cut 5/8" operational counters
    One 8.5"x 11" operational map which represent historical situation on the Lybia/Egypt border
    Two 30” x 26.5” HASL map sheets which combine to represent the historical layout of Halfaya Pass
    One 31” x 23” HASL map sheet which represents the historical layout of the village of Sollum
    Rules pages describing Vehicles/Ordnance notes, BA Scenario Special Rules (SSR), map terrain and campaign game rules
    A divider card for quick reference of SSRs during scenario and CG play

Ownership of the following Hasbro/MMP ASL products are required to play all of the included scenarios: Beyond Valor©, West of Alamein©, Hollow Legions©

Name: Biazza Ridge
Description:
This historical module for Advanced Squad Leader covers main episodes of the Luftwaffe Panzerdivision Hermann Göring counter-offensive in the Gela-Scoglitti sector in Sicily, following the landings of the 1st US Infantry Division "Big Red One" and the 45th US Infantry Division "Thunderbird", in days 10th, 11th and 12th of July 1943.

BIAZZA RIDGE includes the following:

10 action packed scenarios, including 1 campaign games (CG) covering counterattack battles around Gela, Sicily
    20 full color, die cut 1/2" ASL counters
    16 full color, die cut 5/8" ASL counters
    One 38.2” x 35.9” HASL map sheet which represents the historical layout of Biazza Ridge
    One 37.2” x 17.8” HASL map sheet which represents the historical layout of Abbio Priolo (Hill 41)
    One 32.5” x 20.9” HASL map sheet which represents the historical layout of Gela Farello
    Two 20.9” x 19.5” HASL map sheets which represent the historical layout of Piano Lupo (Road Junction Y) and of Ponte Dirillo
    Rules pages describing BR Scenario Special Rules (SSR), map terrain and campaign game rules

Ownership of the following Hasbro/MMP ASL products are required to play all of the included scenarios: Beyond Valor®, Yanks®, Hollow Legions®, boards 19 and 69, overlays OG1-5 and O1-2

Name: MOD: Genel Kültür Oyunu
Description:
MOD is a trivia game supported by a mobile application that contains questions in five different categories with two different game options.

The game features a mobile device, double-sided gaming platform and five pawns in different colours. The current category and difficulty on the platform are selected in the application to see the question to be answered. The game platform consists of three rings and is based on the level of difficulties with the questions.

Each round, the player is asked three questions. Players will receive a random category and wildcard by pressing the dice button in the app and select a difficulty level of their choice. Each well-known question is advanced by one household, by medium household by two households, and by difficult households by three households.

—description from the publisher

Name: Materia Prima: The Alchemists Seal Expansion
Description:
The all-dominant race for the Philosopher‘s Stone causes some alchemists to use dirty tricks. With the expansion, alchemists can block hexes with Seal Stones, occupy element mines, and build a resource monopoly. The Expansion also adds new alchemists, homunculi and equipment cards to the base game.

—description from the designer

Name: Return To Sender: The Mail Game
Description:
Also styled as “Return To Sender” The Mail Game and The New Post Office Game!

This appears to be a reasonably straightforward 'roll and move' style game - or more accurately 'spin and move' since a spinner is provided with the game - it is assembled in the centre of the board itself.  It contains a fold out board, instructions, and playing pieces in (at least) five colours - one for each player.  It is themed on the delivery of mail through the US postal service.

Players each start their letter tokens on the "Sender - start here" space on the outermost coil of the spiral, and move around a spiral course of 61 spaces, until reaching one of the blue "Mail delivered - game won" space.  Unusually, the innermost coil of the spiral contains five of these winning spaces (interspersed with hazard spaces), and there is one more winning space at the end of the second coil.  There are two kinds of hazard spaces (yellow = lose a turn; red = go back), as well as green 'do nothing' spaces, and further blue spaces on which nothing happens when landed upon, but which serve as location markers for some of the 'go back' hazards.

The box states "A Thomas Game - manufactured by American Game & Dice manufacturing Co., Cleveland, Ohio", and the rules leaflet says "A Thomas Game, 4191 Weymouth Road, Medina, Ohio, 44256-9247".

—user summary
Families: Theme: Mail / Stamps / The Post Office

Name: Maximillian 1934
Description:
Maximillian is a tabletop vehicle combat game set in a dystopian 1930s World. Players battle with heavily armed cars and bikes amid the roar of engines powered by alcohol and aviation fuel!
Power-slide and corner your way around the table and/or terrain, by using a special cornering template. Driving skill, the size and handling of a vehicle, and vehicle’s speed influence success or failure in a turn or manoeuvre.
Get your vehicle ready and we’ll see you out there on the roads, driver! Tally-Ho!

—description from the publisher

Name: The WitchBorn: Daughters of Twilight
Description:
Just Don’t Call Them Dark Elves!

Far beneath tortured Perdition lays a honeycomb of twisting turnnels and deep caverns. Venture from a dark and Hidden Realm to brave the blinding light of The WitchBorn ravaged world. These are the Daughters of Twilight.

—description from the publisher

Name: Carbonfighters
Description:
Carbonfighters is a resource management racing board game for 2-6 players simulating a five Grand Prix formula racing season during which you constantly develope your racecar and pitcrew while competing to be the champion by winning the most GPs.

Grands Prix take place on five different modular tracks made up from hexa tiles. As the season evolves tracks become more and more complex. There are two kinds of resources: tyres and fuel. You spend them according to the racetrack tiles you move onto and the development state of your vehicle. You need to pick a driver too who’s resource saving abilities you fancy.

At the beginning of each Grand Prix you choose from two strategies. According to your decision movement cards are dealt to you with movement points on them to move forward on the track. Your strategy decides if you can use higher or lower numbered movement cards.

Qualifying determines the starting order of the players’ cars. A Grand Prix consists of rounds until someone reaches the final tile. Each round consists of the following steps:

     Choosing a card or using the slipstream card.
     Spending resources 
     Resolving action situation when cars are in front 
     Announcing pit stops to refill your resources and activate driver abilities


After the Grand Prix is finished medals are given to the first three players. All players get also victory points according to how many tiles they have reached. These are for developing your car and/or pitcrew before the next Grand Prix.

—description from the designer

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Neutral Heroes II
Description:
Many Figures in Westeros do not Work for one Faction Alone

Westeros is a land not unfamiliar with war and conflict. Much blood has been shed all across its expanse. During times of strife, there are those that don’t simply stand behind a single banner, but will move from force to force looking to either make some coin or simply follow their own paths and desires. These individuals are no less useful on the battlefield, as they often bring special skills that may not be found under one’s own banner.

The Neutral Heroes II Box has many of these individuals, from all walks of life and from all corners of Westeros. There are new Unit Attachments such as Bronn or Brienne. There’s new Non-Combat Units like Jaqen H’ghar and Tycho Nestoris. There are even new Neutral army commanders like Vargo Hoat and Daario Naharis, complete with their Tactics Cards. Each one can dramatically alter the way an army functions on the battlefield.

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Neutral Stormcrow Mercenaries
Description:
With war happening regularly in Westeros, certain groups have formed around the idea of selling their armed services to anyone who can pay their price.

The Stormcrow Mercenaries are one such group. This unit has moderate stats, but is a perfect addition for players who like Unit Attachments, as their special rules let them take one for fewer points than usual.

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Neutral Stormcrow Archers
Description:
The unrest in Westeros has created a large market for men willing to sell their services to any House willing to pay.

The Stormcrow Archers unit box gives commanders a dedicated ranged attack unit for their forces. Their Longbow attacks can be used to thin out enemy ranks from a distance. Being mercenaries has also made them thrifty, receiving a one point discount on one Unit Attachment that commanders assign to them.

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: Home Port
Description:
Home Port is a shipping themed board game, designed to bring people together around a journey of fun, concentration and celebration. Home Port incorporates economic principles such as supply and demand, cash-flow, buying and selling of both natural resources and containerized goods, as well as various real-life applications affecting the world of shipping and international trade. The pick-up-and-delivery mechanism adds an exciting flow to the game, while the systematic movement of sailing ships across the map creates an awareness of physical and time constraints. The game plays 2-5 players for about 60-90 minutes with the aim of acquiring 7 Game Point Tokens first, combining strategic planning, fleet expansion, and financial acceleration.   
All aboard!! Home Port is shipping in some serious fun!

—description from the designer

Name: Match Up!: Promo Game
Description:
Links Promo is a cooperative trivia game with 13 Clue cards and 14 Number cards.
The goal is to Link all the Clue cards to the Number cards on the table. One Number card will remain. Validate its code with the Answer card to know if you win this level.
There are 2 levels in the game.

Name: Chop Chop Ninja Junior
Description:
Chop Chop Ninja Junior is a spin on the classical card battle game with graphics from the Chop Chop Ninja TV Series.

Each player turn its card. The highest wins the hand. If its a tie, a battle begins. The goal of the game is to get all the cards.

—user summary

Name: Génies en Herbe: Les vrais génies
Description:
Trivia games where players are split in two teams. Each team tries to be the fastest to give an answer but if it's wrong, the opposite team gets a right of reply. Questions themes goes from school subjects to public figures passing through sports and general knowledge.

Questions come from the 2017 provincial Génies en herbe tournament in  Thetford Mines, Québec, Canada.

—user summary

Name: Le jeu questionnaire RPM: L'univers de l'automobile
Description:
RPM is a trivia game where you answer question from one of 5 categories: Car race, Who am I (car parts), Jet Set (famous cars and people), Technology and History.

The game progresses on a board where each square indicates one or two question category from which you may choose. You move on the board using die. There are also some bonuses found on the board to help you get to the end faster than your opponents.

—user summary

Name: Speak Out: All About Sports & Games
Description: All About Sports & Games adds 144 new phrases to Speak Out.

Name: You Don't Know Me!
Description:
This addictively entertaining game is an excellent conversation starter and a great way to muse over your life experiences, relive forgotten memories and humorously revisit your youth! You Don’t Know Me! will revolutionize your social get-togethers forever! This multi-generational game makes sharing YOU--your interests, your likes and dislikes, and your life experiences--with your friends and family exciting and fun! Learn to know the people in your life in a way you never thought possible! With over 500 questions to choose from You Don’t Know Me! probes into the depths of each player and breaks down the walls of conversation to find out exactly who does know you! You Don’t Know Me! is a must-have addition to any game collection--perfect for game nights, family reunions, holidays, teachers, ice-breakers, slumber parties, co-worker functions, or couples outings!

—description from publisher

Name: Zonkers: Dice Game
Description:
Zonkers is the fast and frantic dice game. Players are given 5 dice of the same colour and 6 cards are laid out in front of them.

The head-to-head style play starts with players frantically rolling their dice and matching the number with the correct dice graphic on the cards. When the cards are filled with dice, or when a player places their last die, the round ends and the player with the most dice on a card wins.

The total game time is 15-30 minutes and there are 6 different variations to try. Great travel game to keep kids entertained.

—description from the publisher

Name: Das grosse Schweizer Hüttenspiel
Description:
A Mountain Adventure in the Swiss Mountains. It's a funy Dice Game about the huts in the Swiss Alps.

—user summary

Ein Bergabenteuer in den Schweizer Alpen. Spannendes Würfelspiel für zwei bis sechs berg- und hüttenbegeisterte Spielerinnen und Spieler ab acht Jahren. Wer schafft es am schnellsten, in jeder der sechs Bergregionen seine Hütte zu besuchen? Neben guter Ausrüstungsplanung und dem nötigen Wetter- und Würfelglück ist richtiges Verhalten im Gebirge und in den Hütten hilfreich, um das Abenteuer gut zu bestehen. Dazu erfährt man viel Interessantes über die einmalig gelegenen Hütten des Schweizer Alpen-Clubs und Privathütten in den Schweizer Alpen. In brenzligen Situationen greift auch der Rega-Helikopter ins Geschehen ein. Viel Spass auf der grossen Hüttentour!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Unternehmen Rösselsprung: Caccia a Tito – Drvar 1944
Description:
"Unternehmen Rösselsprung: Caccia a Tito - Drvar 1944" is a tactical wargame which simulates the operation Rösselsprung (Knight's Move), codename for the avio operation acted by 500th SS Para Battalion to chase Marshal Tito in May 1944. 
Each point is 40-50 men and each turn is about 2 hours each.

This wargame was sent as a gift to the subscribers of the wargame magazine "Para Bellum".
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Hail the King: F'r evil shall cometh
Description:
A fierce two-player card game to save the kingdom of Samavia from an imminent evil that has risen to ravage and claim all.

STORY:
It revolves around the medieval times where a heinous and wicked creature has risen.

The old prophets of Samavia have foreseen this crisis and reckon that a battle between many Guilds or Houses of the kingdom must take place to find the One that will face, fight, lead and hopefully triumph over the beast(s).

HOW TO PLAY:

     Choose one of the houses
     First player draws 3 cards while the second draws 4 cards
     Choose a location or the enemy to conquer - Press your luck with dices - strategize using the cards and give yourself an edge.
     Resolve the battle and place your token on the territory
     Win by conquering 3 territory

Name: サマータイムメモリー (SUMMER TIME MEMORY)
Black Powder: A Dark and Bloody Ground
Description:
Miniature Wargame rules for the French and Indian War.

Fought between 1754 and 1763, this conflict saw the French and British empires fighting for dominance of Canada and North America. The European armies had to overcome harsh weather conditions and the equally unforgiving wilderness before fighting battles and skirmishes in which little quarter was asked for or given.

Includes complete history of the conflict with details of every major battle fought between the two sides. Also included are details of the uniforms, organisation and commanders of the European armies, their colonial regulars and militias, and the various Native American tribes that supported or opposed them. Scenarios are provided for many of the battles of the war along with suggestions for campaign games.

—description from publisher

Name: アニマルウォーズ (ANIMAL WARS)
Panzer Grenadier: Ancient Armor
Description:
Ancient Armor is the 29th issue of Avalanche Press's Golden Journal. The 29th issue features the original American tanks, the license-built Liberty heavy tank (a copy of the British Mark VIII) and M1917 light tank (a copy of the Renault FT17). Though they remained in storage in 1940, they saw no World War II combat action.

The 8 scenarios feature hypothetical defense of Guam and Ireland.

—description from the description
Families: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements

Name: BannerWar
Description:
Tabletop wargame for mass battles, historical or fantasy. The 2 versions of the rule share the same principles for orders, combat and fire.

3 levels: from tactical to strategical.

Standard : ~13 units / ~1h 
Epic : ~30 units / 2h 
Legend: ~50 units / 3h

BannerWar is a fluid and balanced system. It incorporates combat and fire resolution suitable for tactical battles.
On a strategical level, the rules add orders and deployment principles.
It takes into account a wide variety of troops while keeping the rules simple.
Its army lists offer real options on a tactical as well as on a strategical level.
Faster than most, it does not require more figures than other rulesets.

—user summary

BannerWar comprend une version de règles Historique et une version Fantastique. Les deux versions utilisent les mêmes mécaniques de jeu pour les ordres, les combats et les tirs, cependant la version historique est plus détaillée sur la formation des armées, les manoeuvres stratégiques et la psychologie ; alors que la version fantastique est plus accentuée sur la diversité et l'originalité avec quelques règles spéciales qui donnent beaucoup de caractère aux unités.

La version historique offre des champs de bataille variés et très agréables, qui rendent les parties fortement stratégiques. Elle apporte la possibilité de garder des troupes en réserve, en renfort, en embuscade ou de les mettre en avant garde ou arrière garde. Cette version est accés sur le réalisme grâce aux règles d'ardeur et de résistance. Les unités se déplacent et combattent de manière historique sans être noyées de règles spéciales.

La version fantastique est allégée sur la stratégie des terrains et des corps d'armée. Les contraintes de déplacement et certaines phases de jeu sont moins détaillées pour faire place à des règles sur les Monstres, les Créatures Volantes, les unités mythiques, les Héros et la Magie.

Bien entendu comme le système de jeu est commun, il est tout à fait possible (et même recommandé à terme) de jouer la totalité des règles de BannerWar. Cela ne rend pas les parties bien plus longues ni moins fuides; et cela permet d'avoir un jeu historique ou fantastique d'un grand réalisme avec une diversité de troupes trés élevée qui se joue autant sur la partie tactique que stratégique.

—description from the publisher

Name: Too Many Ghosts!
Description:
Too Many Ghosts! mixes the collaborative experience of Pandemic and Forbidden Island with the mounting pressure and complexity of Oregon Trail, and the set-collection mechanic of Sushi Go. It's an explosive recipe that will have friends and family coming together to battle ghosts to score the best payday possible.

So if you're into mischievous ghosts, making bank, or just getting along at game night, then give Too Many Ghosts! a try.

—description from the publisher

Name: Baladana
Description:
Baladãna is a new and exciting strategy game for two players.
There are some obvious similarities with chess, however Baladãna is more abstract and even more complex and dynamic.
The biggest difference is that while in chess the way each playing piece can move is always the same, in Baladãna, the way figures can move is dynamic, determined by their 'powers'. The configuration of these powers, represented by the colored rings, is updated throughout the game - players can change the position of one ring as part of each move, placing up to 3 rings on any figure. When more rings of different colors are placed on a figure the powers combine.
The objective is to capture both of your opponent's golden rings.

—description from the designer

Name: Eight Wizards
Description:
å…«äººã®é­”è¡“å¸« (Hachi-nin no majutsu-shi) Eight Wizards is a two player fantasy card game from Japan.

In the distant past, two rival beings possessing unimaginable magical power clashed for control of the world. In the end, their conflict triggered an incredible explosion of energy, resulting in the mutual destruction of these god-like beings. This explosion was so powerful, it twisted the very fabric of reality in upon itself, ripping the world in two and leaving time to flow in an infinite loop. Those who survived the brutal conflict soon realized the energy of these dead gods was slowly being drawn to the central point where the two worlds now met. Skilled in the art of energy manipulation, those known as Summoners are now able to harness the power stored in this central point, referred to as The Node, to conjure Wizards and Monsters to do battle. By defeating a conjured being in battle, Summoners can capture energy in special Gemstones. Only through the use of these energy-filled Gemstones can the loop finally be broken and order restored to the world. However, there is a catch. Only the side with the greatest amount of stored energy will survive when the two halves of the world merge once again. With the fate of their world at stake, the battle between the Summoners thus began.

A game consists of 4 rounds with 5 battles. Each round is played as follows:


     The Attacker chooses one card from their hand and plays it face-up on the table. Activate any abilities that apply.
     The Defender then chooses 1 card from their hand and plays it face-up in front of the Attacker's card. Activate any abilities that apply.
     After all relevant abilities have been applied, compare the cards' Power levels. The card with the higher value wins.
     Turn the losing card sideways to the defeated position. (In the case of a tie, turn both cards sideways.) Note: A card is not considered "defeated" if the battle ended in a tie.
     Assign the role of Attacker to the player who won the battle, and Defender to their opponent. (In the case of a tie, the roles of Attacker and Defender remain the same as the previous battle.)
     Repeat steps 1-5 until all 5 battles have been played OR the special win condition is met.


After all 4 rounds are finished, the player with more points showing on their Gemstones is declared the winner.

Name: Aetherium: Wardens of Tianran Core Collective
Description:
The Wardens of Tianran believe that the universe has a distinct cosmic order that regulates its makeup. The Aetherium is part of that singular universe, not a second reality that humanity has somehow “discovered.” Instead, the Wardens of Tianran believe that the mind is set upon a continuum, a path, beneath the material sense and beyond the conscious mind. They are the guardians of that path.

Core Collectives are the fundamental building blocks for an immediate, game-ready Collective. Each Core Collective contains 1 Avatar, 2 Functions, and 2 Subroutines – a complete Collective with unique synergies ready to go.

This set contains 10 models including: The Eternal (Avatar), Seneschal (Function), Unspoken (Function), Tengur Blades (Subroutine 3), Unbound (Subroutine 4), 5 Data Cards, 5 PAD Cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Aetherium: Wardens of Tianran Expansion Set
Description:
The Wardens of Tianran believe that the universe has a distinct cosmic order that regulates its makeup. The Aetherium is part of that singular universe, not a second reality that humanity has somehow “discovered.” Instead, the Wardens of Tianran believe that the mind is set upon a continuum, a path, beneath the material sense and beyond the conscious mind. They are the guardians of that path.

Expansion Sets are a tremendous way to build an entire game-ready Collective straight away. Each Expansion Set contains 1 Avatar, 2 Functions, and 2 Subroutines – a complete and unique Collective with unique synergies ready to go.

This set contains 11 models including: The Elementress (Avatar), Temple Guardian (Function), The Immeasurable One (Omni 50mm base), Jade Spears (Subroutine 5), Condemned (Subroutine 3), 5 Data Cards, 5 PAD Cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Aetherium: Wardens of Tianran Auxiliary Set
Description:
The Wardens of Tianran believe that the universe has a distinct cosmic order that regulates its makeup. The Aetherium is part of that singular universe, not a second reality that humanity has somehow “discovered.” Instead, the Wardens of Tianran believe that the mind is set upon a continuum, a path, beneath the material sense and beyond the conscious mind. They are the guardians of that path.

Auxiliary Sets contain 1 Avatar, 1 Function, and 1 Subroutine and are designed to supplement your favorite Collective with new and extraordinary strategic options. Each Box Set includes both PAD and Data cards for all programs.

This set contains 7 models including: The Ascendant (Avatar- Omni 50mm base), Recurrent (Function), Astraels (Subroutine 5), 3 Data Cards, 3 PAD Cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Aetherium: Wardens of Tianran Core Book
Description:
The Wardens of Tianran believe that the universe has a distinct cosmic order that regulates its makeup. The Aetherium is part of that singular universe, not a second reality that humanity has somehow “discovered.” Instead, the Wardens of Tianran believe that the mind is set upon a continuum, a path, beneath the material sense and beyond the conscious mind. They are the guardians of that path.

48-page full color rulebook includes details of the mysterious Wardens origins, 3 new Operations, description and rules for all 13 programs in the faction, as well as all faction specific rules.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Couples Quiz
Description:
How well do you really know your partner?  Do you think that you know them better than they know you?  In this hilarious game, couples battle it out to find out who knows each other best and who will face the forfeit!  The hilarious game for competitive couples!

—description from the publisher

Name: Scrapyard Rollbot
Description:
This is one of the games featured in Dice & Ink: A Roll & Write Anthology, and exists as part of that compilation.

Scrapyard Rollbot is a solitaire roll & write game based on searching the scrapyard for parts to buid the best robot for the science fair. There are only so many places to search, and your nemesis, Rick, is searching the same yard! Set collection meets area control in this gem!

On your turn:

Roll five six-sided dice,
Use two dice to determine the coordinates of the scrapyard you will search,
Another two dice to determine which part you found,
And the last die to determine what Rick has found.
Don’t forget to check if you unlocked some sweet upgrades to make your scavenging easier!

That’s only the first phase! During the second phase you get to add awesome bling to make your robot stand out even more! Who can make the best robot with scrappy parts? Spoiler alert: Rick has his sights set on that blue ribbon! Good Luck!

—description from the publisher

Name: Little Island Gift Shops
Description:
This is one of the games featured in Dice & Ink: A Roll & Write Anthology, and exists as part of that compilation.

In Little Island Gift Shops, each player assumes the role of a shop owner which sells ocean treasures to the passer by, but is also part of the local community trying to thrive. In this cooperative game, players dive for goods and try to put the best possible combinations of goods in all shops, to get the best score possible for everyone. The lowest scoring shop determines the score for the group. Little Island Gift Shops is a set collection game at its core.

On your turn:

Decide how many hours you will dive,
Roll the corresponding dice: the longer you take, the more dice you roll;
Determine which goods you find,
Then either pay the goods as tribute to the ocean to gain powers, put them in your shop for sale, or gift them to your fellow shop owners.
To be successful in Little Island, you will have to both chase your own high score, but also care for the others at the table.

Little Island Gift Shops requires a four-sided die, a six-sided die, an eight-sided die, and a ten-sided die. Components include one player sheet per player, and one communal player aide.

—description from the publisher

Name: Coral Relief
Description:
This is one of the games featured in Dice & Ink: A Roll & Write Anthology, and exists as part of that compilation.

In Coral Relief, seed and grow coral, attract diverse species to your reef for bonuses and abilities, and control outbreaks of the destructive Crown-of-Thorns Starfish! This is a pattern building game with the added bonus of being able to grow your pattern!

On your turn:

Roll the dice for everyone to use: and decide how the dice are used in your reef:
Two dice develop your reef; die results of 1-4 seed or grow coral to the next stage and results of 5-6 open up special powers.
The final die determines where the crown-of-thorns starfish strikes.
Seems pretty simple right? Not so fast! To attract different species with their own powers, you need to build patterns of coral. Will you be able to attract the right species for the powers you want, will you gain the rare diversity bonus, or will the crown-of-thorns starfish get the best of your reef?

Coral Relief requires three standard six-sided dice in three different colors. Components include one player sheet per player, and one shared diversity sheet per game.

—description from the publisher

Name: God Fodder: A Mint Tin Skirmish
Description:
A fast furious game of facing off with an Elder God! Can you stay sane long enough to win?
Welcome to a time of Gods and Gangsters.
God Fodder is a fast fun Mint Tin Skirmish game for 1-4 players. With 5 characters to choose from with differing abilities, you face off against an Elder God! Each battle will take place in a location with different artifacts (Physical, Magic, Sanity) you can attempt to get to use against the Elder God.

Be careful though, if you lose your mind, you are no longer in control of your fate and may damage the Elder God, Damage your allies, or even heal the Elder God. You might even just gain some of your sanity back! Grab your buddies, get a change of underwear ready and take on God Fodder!

—description from the publisher

Name: Atlantis Rising (Second Edition): Extended Difficulty Mini-Expansion
Description:
Get a sneak peek at future expansion materials, with this promotional set of 24 cards originally made available as a part of the Atlantis Rising Kickstarter campaign.

—description from the publisher

Name: Vamos ao Quadro
Description:
Vamos ao quadro (Let’s go to the black board) is a game for two to four players acting as student.
The goal is to complete the challenges on the books to get exam cards. Each exam card provides the player with points. Whoever has the most points at the end of the game, wins.
Using dice, players can collect the tiles needed to form words, numbers, signs, among other things, to complete the challenges on the books.
In each turn, there are three actions for each student: one mandatory and two optional. Before starting, students should look at their books and see what pieces they will need.

     “Go to the board” - Allocate dice and perform the dice actions. (mandatory)
     “Group work” - Exchange tiles with another student. (optional)
     “Take a test” - Deliver all needed tiles to earn an exam card. (optional)


—description from the designer (English)

“Vamos ao quadro” é um jogo para dois a quatro jogadores.
O objetivo é completar os desafios dos livros para obter cartas de prova. Cada carta de prova atribui ao jogador pontos e quem tiver mais pontos ganha.
Através dos dados, os jogadores conseguem recolher as fichas que necessitam para formar palavras, números, sinais, entre outras coisas, de forma a completar os desafios dos livros.
Em cada turno, existem três ações para cada aluno, uma obrigatória e duas opcionais. Antes de começar os alunos devem observar os seus livros e ver que fichas é que irão precisar. 

     “Ir ao quadro” - Alocar os dados e fazer a ação desses dados. (ação obrigatória) 
     “Trabalho de grupo” - Trocar fichas com outro aluno. (opcional) 
     “Fazer uma prova” - Entregar todas as fichas necessárias para conquistar uma carta de disciplina. (opcional)


—description from the designer (Portuguese)

Name: Complots Deluxe
Description:
Complots Deluxe is an all-in-one package containing Complots + Complots 2 + Complots : Saint BarthÃ©lemy as well as two new exclusive cards: "La Peste" (The Plague) et "Le Mendiant" (The Beggar).

A corrupt city, subject to vice and avarice, is under the control of vile characters. The seat of power is vacant and waiting for you to take it — unless someone else takes it first.

In Complots, as in the original game Coup, you control two characters and start with two coins, and through trickery, manipulation and bluffing, you want to eliminate all other players who stand in your way, possibly by having them eliminate one another along the way.

Name: The Perfect Moment: A Little Espionage Gone Wrong
Description:
The Perfect Moment: A Little Espionage Gone Wrong (1987) is a six-card expansion for The Perfect Moment series that replaces one of the three base sets for a different playing experience.

—description from the publisher

Reimplemented in The Second Most Perfect Moment as a new full base game, together with other two expansions and a solo mode.

Name: Western Legends: Blood Money
Description:
To become a legend, it takes grit, cunning, and a little luck. Problem is, you ain't the only one looking to make a reputation for yourself. So you have to be willing to risk it all, every hard-earned dollar, every drop of blood, to write your name across the face of history.

Blood Money is the second large expansion for Western Legends, introducing a number of modules to tailor every game. The risk module uses a die that improves a number of actions... at the risk of injury. The legendary story module incorporates the story track and high-reward adventures for players to pursue. Players may now purchase deeds to locations and legendary items from the traveling trader. And of course, there is a bevy of new characters and items to explore!

—description from the publisher

Name: Architects of the West Kingdom: Racketeer
Description:
Special Promo for backers of the Spielbox-Kickstarter for Spielbox #1/2020 English version.

Racketeer = Any time you gain 1 Debt, also gain 1 Building Plan
Families: Series: The West Kingdom Trilogy (Garphill Games)

Name: Beat Street
Description:
Beat Street is a board game based on the break dancing craze during the late 1970s to the mid 1980's. As players land on squares, each one has a value and a specific dance move. The player hopes to get a result higher than that number, if not they can attempt to physically attempting that move to get "Beat Street Credits". There are territories on the board, should you advance into another dancer's territory and not beat a move you go to detention or to jail.

—description from the designer

Name: Kryptogram
Description:
Kryptogram is a TableTop word game where you race to spell 4-letter words.
It is a roll & write game where the placement of your letters is more important than the words you spell.

Unlike traditional word games; Kryptogram plays fast, as players race to get the high score each round.

Name: Greif zu!
Description:
The playing figures are placed in the middle of the table, one less than players are playing. Each player gets a hand of cards, again according to the number of players.

The players take turns, giving cards to their neighbor to the left. If a player has collected 4 cards of the same number he may toss them on the table and cry "Greif zu!". Now all players try to grab one of the figures. The player who doesn't get one loses a wooden stick. If a player loses all his sticks he is eliminated from the game. Now two last turns are played to determine the first and second winner (the first players to toss a set of 4 cards).

—user summary

Name: Das Gritzner-Nähmaschinen Spiel
Description:
The players start on space 1. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder of benefit the players. The first player to reach space 50 wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Rivet Wars: Battle of Brighton Kickstarter Roundup
Description:
The Kickstarter Roundup contains additional aerial forces for the Battle of Brighton expansion.

The set consists of two planes with standees for each Blight and Allies, as well as a new weapon plug per faction.

Name: Snake Oil: Joke Juice
Description:
JUNIOR EXPANSION: Combine this Joke Juice expansion pack with the Snake Oil party game to play with 3-10 players age 8+. Gameplay lasts 20-30 minutes.

—description from the publisher

Name: Snake Oil: Crude Oil
Description:
ADULT EXPANSION: Combine this Crude Oil adult expansion pack with the Snake Oil party game to spice up play with 3-10 players age 17+. Gameplay lasts 20-30 minutes.

MATURE CONTENT:  Includes 170 new edgy Word Cards and 15 adult Customer Cards (30 customers).  Mix with Snake Oil core game for over 15 million new NSFW play combinations!

—description from the publisher
